bibl.title: Letter from Joseph A. LePrince to Henry Rose Carter, April 8, 1916

div1.p: LePrince details his preparations for summer field work.

div1.head: Letter from Joseph A. LePrince to Henry Rose Carter, April 8, 1916
div1.opener:
1820 State St
April 8/16
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE
Dear Dr Carter-
div1.p:
I have read over the discussion paper you wrote
me & intend to keep the points in mind - also in my summer
papers so as to keep refreshed on it-. The questions were gotten
up on the assumption that “Yankee” anophelees might act
differently from the “panamans” and for benefit of Taylor &
Devreaux etc - as they can help check up as they have opportu
nity to do so-. I have copied Burkholder's (So. Power Co) letter &
return original to you in case you need it-

Am getting supplies together for summer work - on breeding
out we plan for telescoping funnel mosquito wire comes &
nesting breeding out containers thus wire wire
container
and then for a large chlorofarmer
to cover wire cone - to kill off all adults at one shot
& do away with loss of time - Griffitts has invented a
glass tube container to get them (als adults in houses
alive or dead rapidly with no spilling, or breaking of tube
or recharging necessary- It will save time & loss- I got
results here on 1/1000 aqueous solution of Azure II but
only 20% of specimens showed stain - will use
it stronger - we used 1% on isthmus-. Im coming
more & more to think punes dont like us- Its the flee
in the tail of the dog- It comes to us when the dogs tail
has gone.- The stamax is & other biters do likewise-
If we can find a house without dogs or domestic animals
& poultry near a punk resort we should be in luck-. Von Ezdorf
will probably be back on Monday, 10th, & I will at once take
up with him question of obtaining summers supplies which
I already have listed-.
div1.closer: sincerely yours, J. A. LePrince-. over
